definitions: the admittance of a foreigner to the citizenship of a country

examples.text: an application for naturalization as a British citizen
the naturalization process can be intimidating

shortDefinitions: admittance of foreigner to citizenship of country

definitions: the introduction of a plant or animal to a region where it is not indigenous

examples.text: the first report of naturalization of this species in the United States
the successful naturalization of trout in the barren waters of the Sierra

shortDefinitions: introduction of plant or animal to region where it is not indigenous

definitions: the alteration of an adopted foreign word so that it conforms more closely to the phonology or orthography of the adopting language

examples.text: French naturalization of Creole words or phrases

shortDefinitions: alteration of adopted foreign word so that it conforms more closely

definitions: the act of causing something to appear natural

examples.text: trailers have contributed to the naturalization of a variety of social desires
he continued the naturalization of the landscape, removing the old formal garden

shortDefinitions: act of causing something to appear natural
